plugin.settings.title: OpenAI API Key
plugin.settings.description: Enter the API key for your OpenAI account

plugin.settings.title: Default Text Model
plugin.settings.description:
Select the desired text AI model for non-chat (research) requests.

 - text-davinci-003: Most capable GPT-3 model. Can do any task the other models can do, often with higher quality, longer output and better instruction-following.

- text-curie-001: Very capable, but faster and lower cost than Davinci.

- text-babbage-001: Capable of straightforward tasks, very fast, and lower cost.

- text-ada-001: Capable of very simple tasks, usually the fastest model in the GPT-3 series, and lowest cost.

- ALL: Use with caution. Will generate using all of the primary models. Good for testing.

plugin.settings.title: Research Directory
plugin.settings.description: Select the desired directory to store generated research in.

plugin.settings.title: Target Summary Paragraphs
plugin.settings.description:
Select the desired number of paragraphs to be generated with each summary.
Less than 3 is a good starting point.

plugin.settings.title: Target Key Terms
plugin.settings.description:
Select the desired number of key terms to be generated with each summary.
Less than 5 is a good starting point.

plugin.settings.title: Max Tokens
plugin.settings.description: Maximum amount of tokens any prompt can use.

plugin.settings.NOTE: DO NOT CHANGE THE FOLLOWING SETTINGS; ADD YOUR SETTINGS ABOVE ^^^

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description:
Set how much logging output will be displayed when executing AI commands in NotePlan Plugin Console Logs (NotePlan -> Help -> Plugin Console)

 - DEBUG: Show All Logs
 - INFO: Only Show Info, Warnings, and Errors
 - WARN: Only Show Errors or Warnings
 - ERROR: Only Show Errors
 - none: Don't show any logs
